intro: Conioselinum gayoides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which are surrounded by pale green bracts. Conioselinum gayoides is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
